decks.notes: The deck focuses on using disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with control elements like Fatal Push and Psychic Frog, to counter and remove threats from the opponent. It also utilizes card draw and library manipulation with cards like Ancestral Recall, Ponder, and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage and find key pieces. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recast permanent spells from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent through careful resource management.

The deck is focused on playing aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan, commonly referred to as Hatebears, while using powerful mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Chancellor of the Annex, Archon of Emeria, Void Mirror, and Chalice of the Void can slow down the opponent's spells, while Anointed Peacekeeper and White Plume Adventurer provide additional defense. The deck also includes cards like Karakas and Strip Mine for additional disruption, as well as powerful finishers like Clarion Conqueror. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly building a board presence to win the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Null Rod to disrupt opponents' strategies. The key strategy involves using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. Cards like Show and Tell and Flash help to put these creatures into play quickly. Additionally, the deck includes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Time Walk to maintain card advantage and tempo. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of control elements and powerful creatures.

This deck revolves around the powerful interactions and synergies enabled by utilizing the card Underworld Breach. By leveraging cards like Black Lotus, Ancestral Recall, and various Moxen, the deck aims to quickly assemble a game-winning combo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional flexibility and resilience to the strategy. With access to powerful disruption in cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, along with card draw and tutor effects, the deck is designed to efficiently and effectively execute its combo plan while actively disrupting opponent strategies.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Collector Ouphe, while also maintaining a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck also leverages powerful disruption spells such as Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy to keep the opponent off balance. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and selection in the form of cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm to help maintain card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Treasure Cruise provide additional value and versatility in various matchups.

The deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's plays through countermagic, targeted removal, and hand disruption. It utilizes cheap interaction like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Spell Pierce to protect its game plan while also leveraging cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to manipulate draws. Additionally, it includes powerful card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Lurrus of the Dream-Den to maintain a steady stream of resources. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy, control the board, and ultimately out-value them to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and disruptive creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and tempo. It includes a variety of counterspells, removal, and card draw to control the board and outvalue opponents. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for recurring creatures and spells from the graveyard, adding to the deck's resilience and flexibility. The deck aims to outlast opponents through efficient card selection and disruption, ultimately grinding out victories through strategic play and resource management.

The deck is centered around assembling a winning combination using Doomsday to organize the top five cards of your library in a specific order to win the game. The deck utilizes various cantrips, counter spells, and tutors to find and protect the combo pieces needed to execute the Doomsday plan. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is used as a companion to provide additional value and recursion. By carefully managing resources and timing plays, the deck aims to efficiently and effectively set up the win condition through strategic planning and execution.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements and disrupting opponent's strategies through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to outvalue the opponent by constantly drawing cards with efficient cantrips and high-impact spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and threats, the deck seeks to control the pace of the game and grind out victories. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing cards to be recast from the graveyard, ensuring a steady stream of resources.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while gaining incremental advantages through card advantage and resource management. It utilizes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Force of Will to control the game, while also leveraging the graveyard with cards like Dig Through Time and Lurrus of the Dream-Den. The deck also includes efficient removal options like Fatal Push and disruptive spells like Daze and Spell Pierce. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent by controlling the pace of the game and securing a victory through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Flusterstorm while leveraging the powerful Oath of Druids to cheat big creatures into play. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Null Rod and Stock Up to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck has multiple ways to find key cards like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor, ensuring consistency in executing its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures through Oath of Druids.

The deck focuses on assembling the Coveted Jewel combo by using fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Mishra's Workshop to power out artifacts such as The One Ring and Time Vault. The deck utilizes powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Paradoxical Outcome to dig for key pieces and establish a board presence. With access to disruptive cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through generating infinite turns with cards like Voltaic Key and Manifold Key.

The deck focuses on using efficient hatebears, disruptive creatures that hinder opponents' strategies, along with aggressive creatures to quickly close out the game. It utilizes powerful mana acceleration in the form of Moxen, along with disruptive cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Trinisphere to slow down opponents. Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria provide additional disruption, while Witch Enchanter and White Plume Adventurer generate card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt opponents while applying pressure to win the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the pieces needed to generate a large amount of mana, using cards like Mishra's Workshop, Grim Monolith, and Ancient Tomb. This mana is then used to power out powerful artifacts like Coveted Jewel and Paradox Engine, allowing the player to draw through their deck, generate more mana, and ultimately win the game with cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes disruption and protection in the form of Force of Will, Trinisphere, and Sink into Stupor to ensure the combo can go off smoothly.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Spell Pierce to counter opponent's threats, while cards like Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters handle creatures on the board. The inclusion of disruptive artifacts like Null Rod and Urza's Saga further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful card draw and tutoring effects like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor to ensure that the player has the right answers at the right time.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and disruptive creatures while gradually gaining card advantage and controlling the tempo of the game. It utilizes powerful cards like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk to maintain control and outvalue the opponent over time. By consistently disrupting the opponent's threats and resources, while also drawing additional cards and gaining incremental advantages, this deck seeks to establish dominance and close out the game at its own pace.
